definitions.definition: Word for word; not figuratively; not as an idiom or metaphor
definitions.example: When I saw on the news that there would be no school tomorrow because of the snowstorm, I literally jumped for joy, and hit my head on the ceiling fan.

definitions.definition: (degree, contranym) Used non-literally as an intensifier for figurative statements: virtually, so to speak (often considered incorrect; see usage notes)
definitions.example: He was so surprised, he literally jumped twenty feet in the air.

definitions.definition: Used to intensify or dramatise non-figurative statements; tending towards a meaningless filler word in repeated use.
definitions.example: I had no idea, so I was literally guessing.

definitions.definition: Used as a generic downtoner: just, merely.
definitions.example: You literally put it in the microwave for five minutes and it's done.
